original_title: ‘Unabomber’ Ted Kaczynski, who terrorised the U.S. with mail bombings for nearly two decades, dies in prison
original_body_lines: Colombo (News 1st) – Ted Kaczynski, the lone terrorist known as the Unabomber who carried out a wave of parcel bombings in the U.S. for 18 years from 1978-95, killing 3 people and wounding dozens, has died in prison at the age of 81.
The hunt for the Unabomber frustrated the FBI for many years until he was arrested on a tipoff by his own brother. He lived in a cabin in the rural forests of the state of Montana.
Kaczynski, who was later diagnosed as a paranoid schizophrenic, was motivated by a deep hatred of humanity, rather than any particular political ideology.
He was serving eight life sentences when he died in his cell in a federal prison in North Carolina.
